messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] general public's take on hsing was: about imm
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 02/13/2001 7:45:02 PM !!!First Boot!!!, ... Really?  I don t get that feeling at all.  We have only been doing this for a couple of years,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 02/13/2001 7:45:02 PM !!!First Boot!!!,
insomniaaks@... writes:


ANY case of
> unsuccessful (or
> not-on-school-schedule) homeschooling is seen as
> damning to the whole idea of
> it.
>
> Sandra



Really?  I don't get that feeling at all.  We have only been doing this for a
couple of years, so I guess my two aren't completely screwed up yet.  :)  But
we have made a few changes so far and probably will make many more as we
figure things out.  But I never get the feeling (or the response) that anyone
around here thinks we aren't doing the right thing by keeping the kids out of
ps.

Hmmm. . . maybe things are getting better as far as the public's perception
of hsing.  At least in our tiny town.

Nance
